description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2to1g","text":"This protocol provides a general method to prepare fixed cells for immunofluorescence imaging, e.g., by confocal microscopy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"db72a","text":"Cell culture -- sterile materials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25mkg","text":"PBS (Thermo J67802.AP)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qjgg","text":"24-well glass bottom plate (Cellvis P24-1.5H-N)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jha9","text":"0.1% poly-L-lysine solution (Sigma A-420-10)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erbko","text":"Glycine (Sigma 34860-2L-R)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bm5ss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ocq7","text":"Prepare-ahead buffers (see protocol for more details)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ooim","text":"PBS (from MedChemExpress HY-K1023, filtered)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0u6q","text":"PBS-T (PBS with 0.02% Tween-20)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9iqs","text":"PBS-TritonX (PBS with 0.3%-0.4% Triton-X 100) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edk20","text":"PBS-PFA (PBS with 4% PFA; prepared fresh)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32jqe","text":"PBS-Block (PBS with 3% BSA and 22.52 mg/mL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0flo","text":"100% methanol pre-chilled at -20 degrees celsius","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j339","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rdm2","text":" Representative secondary antibodies and conjugates:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4daqo","text":" status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7h7bi","text":"Dilute 0.1% poly-L-lysine solution (Sigma P8920) in PBS (0.01%). Make enough solution for 0.5 mL per well, plus some excess.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cee5p","text":"Add 0.5 mL of the diluted poly-L-lysine solution (0.01% in PBS) to each well of a 24-well glass bottom plate (Cellvis P24-1.5H-N). Place the plate back in the cell culture incubator (37 °C, 5% CO2) for 1 – 24 h to adhere the solution to the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":195,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6jq04","text":"Wash the wells 3x with sterile PBS or water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"199lm","text":"Add 1 mL of cell culture medium to each well, then plate cells at an appropriate density such that they are not more than 70% confluent on the day of the experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emi3v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7scjj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Use DMEM for iBMDMs and HEK293(T)s. For these cell types, seed the cells at approximately ~15% confluence for iBMDM or ~30% for HEK293Ts to have an ideal cell density for imaging the next day.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7q0du","text":"Aspirate the cell culture medium and add 1 mL of pre-warmed PBS-PFA to each well. Incubate for 10 mins with gentle rocking at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7k1d5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fp8km","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Certain cell types can be extremely labile, and so use caution when aspirating and adding fixation medium. Alternatively, you can add 8% PBS-PFA directly to the cell culture medium (1:1 volumetric ratio for a final concentration of 4%), which can prevent tricky cells from lifting off of the plate.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5dgdr","text":"Prepare fresh solutions for IF including: PBS, PBST (PBS with 0.02% Tween-20), PBS-Triton (PBS with 0.3%-0.4% Triton-X 100) or 100% methanol pre-chilled at -20 degrees celsius, PBST-Block (see step 5.1 below), and PBS-PFA (see step 5.2 below).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u12q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"35ve","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Different antibodies work with different fixation and permeabilization protocols. Additionally, certain organellar populations are better preserved with alternative fixation/permeabilization protocols. For example, we've found that lysosomes and other vesicles are better resolved with methanol permeabilization instead of PBS-TritonX (see note at step 8 for that particular alternative). Because of the difference in permeabilization temperatures, we recommend using different plates if you intend to conduct experiments in parallel that require different permeabilization protocols. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ddh42","text":"Conduct relevant cellular treatment(s). Stagger any treatments so that all of the wells of the plate are ready to harvest simultaneously.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54mhi","text":"Wash cells 3x with 1 mL PBST. For the first wash, aspirate immediately and replace with PBST, and then conduct the subsequent washes over 5-10 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1dia5","text":"For Triton-X 100 permeabilization, slowly add 1 mL of PBS-Triton directly to each well then immediately aspirate the solution (this can help prevent the formation of aggregates). Replace with 1 mL PBS-Triton and incubate at RT for 10 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"633k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gr22","text":"PFA-containing waste should be collected and disposed of properly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6smfl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bl4hd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"For methanol permeabilization, instead first wash the plate 3x with PBS, prior to adding 1 mL cold methanol (-20 degrees) to each well and placing the plate at -20 degrees celsius for 10 min. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"el0p5","text":"To prepare PBS-PFA, freshly dilute an ampule of 16% paraformaldehyde (PFA; Electron Microscopy Sciences 15710) in PBS to 4% (add the 10 mL ampule to 30 mL of PBS) in a falcon tube. Warm the solution to 37 degrees celsius prior to fixation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ee29","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8k7n0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"PFA is toxic, so do this step carefully in a chemical hood. Additionally, be careful when breaking the glass ampule.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3iiip","text":"The next day, wash wells 3x with 1 mL PBST. For the first wash, aspirate immediately and replace with PBST, and then conduct the subsequent washes over 5-10 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qkn","text":"Dilute primary antibodies in pre-chilled PBST-Block on ice. Aspirate the wells and add 200 μL of the antibody solution to each well. Rock gently at 4 degrees celsius overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc0vg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3q9ke","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ccn9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Note that some organelles, like mitochondria, have significant autofluorescence in the 488 channel. Additionally, with multiple primary/secondary combinations, bleed through can occur. Control wells lacking particular primary antibodies (minus-one controls) should always be included at least once to assess bleed-through and autofluorescence with a given set of cells, antibodies, and laser settings.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8e7ls","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":23,"offset":64}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2oqn9","text":"A useful resource for checking dyes and fluorophores is FPbase: https://www.fpbase.org/","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"3F2C2ABAF8EA11EE99240A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.fpbase.org"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tqcf","text":"Aspirate PBST, and add 0.5 mL PBST-Block to each well. Incubate at RT for 1 h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"99g6p","text":"To prepare PBST-Block, dissolve 3% BSA and 22.52 mg/mL glycine in PBST (for example, add 1.5 g BSA and 1.126 g glycine to 50 mL PBST). Glycine binds free aldehyde groups (from PFA) to prevent antibody crosslinking and thus high background, whereas BSA reduces nonspecific antibody binding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9jem","text":"Dilute fluorescent secondaries (see materials) 1:200 in PBST-Block.  Phalloidin can also be added at this step. Aspirate the wells and add 200 μL of secondary antibody solution to each well. Rock gently at RT for 60-90 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k95p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9nvbf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Wrap the plate in aluminum foil to minimize fluorophore quenching over subsequent incubation and wash steps.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2srvr","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"50s35","text":"If possible, spread the secondary antibodies out as far as possible to avoid bleed-through (e.g., 488 and 647). ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1g1lo","text":"Wash cells 3x with 1 mL PBST. For the first wash, aspirate immediately and replace with PBST, and then conduct the subsequent washes over 5-10 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1dgbk","text":"Aspirate the PBST and add Hoechst 33342 (0.5 mL, 5 μM in PBS) to each well, if desired. Hoechst labels nuclei in the ~405 channel. Incubate at RT for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77od8","text":"Wash cells 3x with 1 mL PBS. For the first wash, aspirate immediately and replace with PBST, and then conduct the subsequent washes over 5-10 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20b39","text":"Keep cells at RT if imaging with the same day (ideal), or transfer the plate to 4 degrees celsius for imaging at a later time. Image the plate within ~3 - 5 d with an appropriate confocal microscope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4ocf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce3ni","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"24rkd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Imaging settings highly depend on the cells and antibodies used in the experiment, in addition to the cellular phenomenon. We thus recommend consulting with an imaging core during imaging optimization.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Preparing fixed cells for immunofluorescence
